bugs.title: CVE-2023-22655 kernel: local privilege escalation on Intel microcode on Intel(R) Xeon(R)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-22655 kernel: local privilege escalation on Intel microcode on Intel(R) Xeon(R)

long_desc.thetext:
Protection mechanism failure in some 3rd and 4th Generation Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processors when using Intel(R) SGX or Intel(R) TDX may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00960.html

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2270720]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-28746 kernel: Local information disclosure on Intel(R) Atom(R) processors

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-28746 kernel: Local information disclosure on Intel(R) Atom(R) processors

long_desc.thetext:
Information exposure through microarchitectural state after transient execution from some register files for some Intel(R) Atom(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00898.html

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2270731]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2024:5101 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:5101

bugs.title: CVE-2023-38575 kernel: Local information disclosure in some Intel(R) processors

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-38575 kernel: Local information disclosure in some Intel(R) processors

long_desc.thetext:
Non-transparent sharing of return predictor targets between contexts in some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00982.html

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2270735]

"Intel is releasing a firmware update to mitigate this potential vulnerability."
And again, another microcode, not kernel.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-39368 kernel: Possible Denial of Service on Intel(R) Processors

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-39368 kernel: Possible Denial of Service on Intel(R) Processors

long_desc.thetext:
Protection mechanism failure of bus lock regulator for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via network access.

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00972.html

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2270736]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-43490 kernel: Local information disclosure on Intel(R) Xeon(R) D processors with Intel(R) SGX due to incorrect calculation in microcode

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-43490 kernel: Local information disclosure on Intel(R) Xeon(R) D processors with Intel(R) SGX due to incorrect calculation in microcode

long_desc.thetext:
Incorrect calculation in microcode keying mechanism for some Intel(R) Xeon(R) D Processors with Intel(R) SGX may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-01045.html

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2270737]

bugs.title: TRIAGE CVE-2023-22655 kernel: local privilege escalation on Intel microcode on Intel(R) Xeon(R) [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: TRIAGE CVE-2023-22655 kernel: local privilege escalation on Intel microcode on Intel(R) Xeon(R) [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-22655 kernel: local privilege escalation on Intel microcode on Intel(R) Xeon(R)

long_desc.thetext:
Protection mechanism failure in some 3rd and 4th Generation Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processors when using Intel(R) SGX or Intel(R) TDX may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00960.html

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2270720]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2270698

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2270698,2270720

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
Per upstream, the fixes for this are in microcode, not kernel.

FEDORA-2024-96f3c3f3d3 (microcode_ctl-2.1-61.1.fc40) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40.

`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-f3692f8528`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-f3692f8528

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-45733 intel-microcode: Race conditions in some Intel(R) Processors

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-45733 intel-microcode: Race conditions in some Intel(R) Processors

long_desc.thetext:
Hardware logic contains race conditions in some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable partial information disclosure via local access.

References:

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-01051.html

Created microcode_ctl tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2292297]

Upstream fix:

https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files/releases/tag/microcode-20240514

bugs.title: CVE-2023-46103 intel-microcode: Unexpected behavior in Intel(R) Core(TM) Ultra Processors

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-46103 intel-microcode: Unexpected behavior in Intel(R) Core(TM) Ultra Processors

long_desc.thetext:
Sequence of processor instructions leads to unexpected behavior in Intel(R) Core(TM) Ultra Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.

References:

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-01052.html
https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files/releases/tag/microcode-20240514

Created microcode_ctl tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2292301]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-46103 microcode_ctl: intel-microcode: Unexpected behavior in Intel(R) Core(TM) Ultra Processors [fedora-all]

long_desc.thetext:

Created microcode_ctl tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2292301]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2292300

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2292300,2292301

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
